column4: so i'm trying to get ubuntu to dualboot nicely under vista, but i didn't install grub. what should i do now?
can i not boot ubuntu under the vista bootloader?
you can, but it probably is easier to install grub
the reason i ask is because i have a recovery partition from lenovo, which im not sure grub will play nicely with
ok, thanks im gonna check it out
looking at it now, it might not be too helpful :P
heh, yeah it seems to be for using grub
so i install grub onto the linux partition then?
even if ubuntu has already been installed?
you'll probably need to I think - every time there is a kernel update, the loading stuff changes, which is why grub is easier
you can install GRUB to the Ubuntu partition, and then load GRUB from the Windows bootloader
ok, that sounds like an awesome plan.
it doesn't involve messing with your MBR at all
and i do this by livecd'ing ubuntu?
I think that's how it works -- I'm not too on top of this bootloader stuff so I can't give you directions
with the clever use of dd you should be able to copy that partition and make a dvd out of it
